title: Real-life 'Sleeping Beauty' who falls into slumber for up to two months
text:

A teenager has been dubbed 'Sleeping Beauty' because of a rare illness that has seen her fall into a slumber for up to two months.

Sharik Tovar, 17, suffers from Kleine-Levin syndrome and often loses her memory after the sleeping episodes.

She lives with her mother Marleny Tovar, who liquefies all her food and feeds her every two hours.

Only around 40 cases have been reported around the world, it is understood.

Marleny, from the town of Acacias in the Meta Department, in the centre of Colombia, told local news outlet Noticias Caracol: "After a 48-day sleeping episode in June last year she lost her memory temporarily. She asked me who I was."

(Image: CEN/Noticias Caracol)

(Image: CEN/Noticias Caracol)

The mother has asked the national health service EPS Capital Salud for the food supplements the teenager needs to be fed while she is sleeping.

And she has also requested urgent neurological treatment.

She told reporters: "The maximum she has slept was two months."

According to Marleny, the health service has not supplied the supplements for two months and she has to prepare shakes herself to feed the girl while she is sleeping.

(Image: CEN)

She told reporters in 2017: "Her food is all liquid, I cook and liquefy everything, I feed her every two hours, and I haven't put a catheter in her because I am still able to feed her".

The family also requested a house from the municipality in November 2017 to live in as Marleny had to quit her job to look after her daughter and she cannot afford to pay the rent.

At the time, the Mayor of Acacias Orlando Gutierrez promised to give Sharik and her family a house, but that has not happened.

(Image: CEN)

Gutierrez told Noticias Caracol he was busy on other matters, saying: "We are solving an issue related to the end of the construction with the underground tanks that we need to be able to store water".

According to Noticias Caracol, EPS Capital Salud in the Meta Department could not be contacted to be asked about the food supplements.

Kleine-Levin syndrome is characterised by persistent hypersomnia and cognitive or mood changes with episodes typically lasting more than a week, and sometimes for months.

It is currently unknown what causes KLS, although the condition usually follows a viral infection.
description: Sharik Tovar, 17, from Colombia, is fed every two hours by her mother who liquidises all her food
